document.title: Illinois ABE/ASE Reading Content Standards and Benchmarks

6C141E0F46FA425D961984CB6DAA1A62.description: Apply environmental reading to life skills (e.g., a brochure on workplace medical benefits and/or a consumer guide about long distance phone service).

9BD490E3737E442D9697DE24506988F6.description: Identify the writer's style (e.g., repetition of a key word, use of a string of opposites) used to convey ideas.

5FC4FCB7D930499AB7C8E7B667A5AD5D.description: Differentiate between fact and opinion in order to make decisions by comparing and contrasting facts.

2B9769D2BE3E4AA08643C14EE8100FB3.description: Analyze a character in a fictional passage by identifying the character's appearance, behaviors, actions, and dialogue with other characters.

BFBF96CF6AD14021AF6814253EB57779.description: Locate information on a given topic in several types of reference materials (e.g., dictionary, Internet, newspaper).

F60C827AD6E14F0187E7A388D91DF902.description: Make generalizations from implicit ideas (e.g., first paragraph of The Declaration of Independence).

72E91B0BF26E4CDC96491DC4A92B706A.description: Determine a character's motivation in a play by examining the character's dialogue, actions, and stage directions.

A7A4E592333C4EC08C1E9508EBE765F9.description: Identify phrases or words that the author used to create an image or mental picture in a poem.

AC02F831254E438C96012F5045191769.description: Identify the moral of a short story or a play.

76963E059D334B2797360B663E98E594.description: Compare and contrast the personalities of two characters in a story.

A237DABDFE3C4F8A99135A1A1E87355E.description: Identify directly stated and implied main ideas based on stated and suggested information.

4070C0F1F04E45AB82B6B2501BF263D6.description: Follow complex instructions or directions that include conditionals (e.g., if and then statement) and multiple steps.

D78590625C724BBB840E77FECF4FA997.description: Demonstrate understanding of specialized vocabulary from the content areas (e.g., science, social studies, and Constitution).

ABD8036683424D628E0972F27D2EBA79.description: Apply environmental reading to life skills (e.g., read a campus catalog, read instructions from a job-search-focused website).

03763564376C4CF0ACE9AC16DA66C159.description: Use a graphic organizer to demonstrate the importance of and relationship between ideas (e.g., Venn diagram, webbing, and mapping).

31DC9539146149DDB09141AC1F8235BA.description: Identify opinions, propaganda, and bias within written publications (e.g., newspapers, political cartoons).

D3D0887D37C442CEAEFBC76936E34EB3.description: Recognize differences in structure, content, and tone of various texts.

7F377B2D60734AD18256B0CD8D72A34A.description: Identify relationships between similar documents (e.g., order form and invoice) and compare information for accuracy.

05C35752ED864A149F66E3E18B52DAB5.description: Follow directions necessary to perform a moderately complex sequential task.

12230A55F5D240A4A907187A17902937.description: Interpret information in context (e.g., medical, occupational, parenting) and apply that information to a new situation.

C2DE6C7A91984C908E8D77FCC55C7E1E.description: Identify and interpret common figurative language (e.g., simile, metaphor, hyperbole) found in a literary work or poem.

D6FE630E233E4ED6A71D973D46BBDC22.description: Identify the elements of a plot (e.g., beginning, exposition, middle-complications and climax; end-resolution) within a literary work.

CC854FBB8A064F95B1287A642BE93853.description: Identify the central idea or theme of a literary work (e.g., short story, drama, poetry).

3EF092C66ED641EBB2C672BF9843058D.description: Read a technical manual or a legal document and explain a sequential process about a complex and unfamiliar work procedure.

9F89A5FD99DB44CEB48B3A98BA601D0A.description: Identify and restate in own words the implied main idea from symbols used to represent a person, place, or thing (e.g., political cartoon) or main idea of a multi-paragraph passage.

57BB6491582D4D07ACD6C4F563BF7BB9.description: Demonstrate understanding of synonyms, antonyms and different applications of the same word (multiple meanings).

2F7AAC7B7D98474E99B4B04C2884F896.description: Demonstrate understanding of language structures by focusing on idioms, expressions, colloquialisms and literary structures.

713CFA0DFCE64CD4A32B29F965A8191F.description: Apply environmental reading to life skills (e.g., read and summarize a brief message addressed to a group of co-workers, read simple directions for a fax or computer to perform the sequence of tasks).

F5094FFE983D4FE59D87FC52B849BCAE.description: Begin to identify and interpret similes and metaphors.

15DE79BCD54542519588BC9B7451BE3F.description: Determine the appropriate reading strategy to acquire specific information (e.g., rereading, skimming, and scanning).

9C58CEEF74CD4661939169263609889E.description: Demonstrate an awareness of the difference between the use of English in formal and informal settings.

508FFCB00DFE4046BC6FB78235800D14.description: Clarify understanding of non-fictional passages by creating outlines, graphic organizers, logical notes, summaries, or reports.

E3A172394D5546ABBC5B4963776EB3D8.description: Integrate information from texts, charts, and graphs to draw a conclusion.

DC12AC57A88E433DB26C2516F0956295.description: Determine the meaning of persuasive language and faulty logic used in print and visual material (e.g., advertisement).

F4D1F68478574AB9A9BD362A74768A91.description: Identify features that distinguish fiction, drama, poetry, fables, and legends.

210069A8B2A64A358F7002DA5DCB1E60.description: Predict probable outcomes from knowledge of events obtained from a reading selection.

CC210AE8A9624F5BACD2F4FB3B1F57DB.description: Be able to summarize what has been read.

7AA4B9F8E83D411F87060A81921CA5BE.description: Identify cause and effect implied in a paragraph.

677E53E492D64F0CBBA59326BE977751.description: Identify the implied main idea and supporting details from an instructional level passage.

C6C2F115CFB0416C8B597D448D7EF9D1.description: Determine author's purpose (e.g., to entertain, inform, and persuade) from a variety of written pieces (e.g., newspaper article, travel brochure, and store catalog).

6BBF292C34094F05827B513C394A05ED.description: Select, explore, and evaluate sources, such as a dictionary, Internet, magazine, and newspaper, to obtain and to evaluate information for a specific task using research as serves the student's purpose.

063085A3954F4C83A5671BE783110AAE.description: Identify and use the structural features of newspapers, magazines, and editorials.

DFC8C15DF958446E9CCFF9000F1B46B0.description: Read and interpret information in newspapers, and periodicals.

7112D72E2B994C68B885D5334F64137D.description: Demonstrate an awareness of the difference between the use of English in formal and informal settings (e.g., formal vs. slang use in a job interview).

E2EB8E4F1CC74603BDE4325327BB608F.description: Recognize and understand clipped and shortened words (e.g., exam-examination).

3CE7D3A68A8C4EFE8B48D4A3EAEAE638.description: Identify idioms and their use in passages.

8FCC3BA597F349B3BF322B06A2168FF9.description: Identify and interpret basic figurative language (e.g., similes, metaphors, pun, and alliteration).

31B74A0DEAC7416AACBF443D65E489EB.description: Use a dictionary to locate the meaning of words used in a statement.

12D8E1EC2DDE4E27B3EAD640B43D50C0.description: Apply environmental reading to life skills (e.g., read nutrition charts).

2021CD32AD0A4A26906B297573636DE9.description: Read instructional level narrative and expository text aloud at a conversational rate with expression and accuracy.

902E0D0BF99B48E4B012C1AB454CC2E3.description: Determine the sequence of events in a written passage.

594F54C3595E400790C9CAE337274E1A.description: Skim for overall understanding and scan for keywords and ideas.

F61B726A670E492797FF79A7EA887065.description: At instructional level, formulate questions while reading text.

FC924EAC3E6C4B5EABE6045A3F24738B.description: Identify and apply appropriate strategies to aid comprehension (e.g., graphic organizers, outlining).

1F20F483D1F54DFBBC88D68EC0FC249E.description: Make inferences about short passages at grade-level (e.g., identifying correct multiple choice answers or writing short answers to questions).

4636513A0F79475B83C2C3C3A2C34381.description: Determine the appropriate reading strategy to acquire specific information (e.g., rereading, skimming, and scanning).

D462FF9B5DF14C32A4492D0AD243529F.description: Locate pertinent information in multi-paragraph passages and apply it to answer a question.

5E5925B35C3E49DFB95168A24BCF2628.description: Summarize the main idea of a passage by answering who, what, when, why, and how questions.

761D7D1715E84BD4882B864F0CEAFA24.description: Identify cause/effect signal words in sentences (e.g., as a result, because, consequently, thus).

BD0F9A0FC8E049D6AE2A24B46330E75D.description: Begin to use comparison and contrast.

824B6A2413284667900C3F61A4D32E74.description: Read and interpret simplified policies/procedures (e.g., simple employee handbooks, driver's manual).

117C36D7826047249E7D5E022564FC55.description: Locate specific information in a text.

A70960944833412DA7C71A4204FAD290.description: Follow simple written multi-step instructions and diagrams.

9CFFB5D36FC042CCA5C7774C6438E5FD.description: Recognize the correct meaning of multiple-meaning words (e.g., bill, train) when presented in text.

7AAEEB4A361D4ED9A438CDD02725E58A.description: Use context clues to determine meaning of unfamiliar words.

EF111195FA544F198DC4D291279D6752.description: Identify the meaning of frequently used synonyms, antonyms, and homonyms for grade-level words.

9259CFD210504E59AC6B5801C91DFCB9.description: Use phonics, word structure, and visual cues to identify words.

7963574232E446188FEAB7E763A60063.description: Apply environmental reading to life skills (e.g., read a job ad, determine meaning of technical vocabulary, understand and use safety language).

9495E0D27F6E4B508C3E4A0BEA5568B2.description: Read orally at a conversational rate with accuracy, expression, and comprehension, recognizing punctuation signals in texts designed for this instructional level.

62137D412EB34816B3ED0C7790204C5D.description: Self-monitor and clearly identify specific words or wordings that are causing comprehension difficulties (e.g., circling or underlining difficult words, creating word banks).

E451CAE4F3274B8E85134CE315EFF7F7.description: Use graphic organizers to determine meaning in texts written for this instructional level (e.g., story maps, K-W-L).

9277CDB5C94D40ED84BA5DDD69515263.description: At instructional level, identify the story elements including setting, plot, and character.

844EB044485D4D1585BE2F0B93A0D63E.description: Determine the sequence in a process (e.g., set of directions, missing item, events in a story).

4427D1C2C8EA47B3A156710B48BB3C02.description: Follow a set of grade-level written directions.

0018298ACABC4EB59FCDEE898E4C7ABB.description: Orally paraphrase a grade-level written passage.

02AA3A124E434A2C83EFE2D17C0B4E82.description: Use newspaper headlines or other titles to draw conclusions and make inferences about simple written materials.

E506EA803BCD4C5CA71EE03AA2B73D55.description: Interpret information from diagrams, charts, and graphs.

40D2A65E99554F17B168E130529EC24A.description: Begin to use comparison and contrast to draw conclusions in a passage.

7A7A01978F8B421689D54BAAD6A85C9B.description: Begin to distinguish between fact and opinion in a passage.

133B8EE48D184A59B0AF3448C9CFB7A1.description: Locate specific items in an alphabetical listing (e.g., class list, phone directory, dictionary) or in a topical listing (e.g., picture dictionary, table of contents).

365941C9F14A492186843E33EE4CC2CE.description: Locate stated information in functional reading (e.g., bulletins, invitations).

AB8BC726037C4F1AB923E3968BFD333B.description: Read and interpret compound sentences in a short paragraph containing familiar grade-level vocabulary

39EF32EF983746438615084DB15FF632.description: Sort words into categories to show relationships and make explicit the connections seen among meanings.

A0D623D1CAF540D482B92BB5CE1E089E.description: Demonstrate ability to read personal information presented on a simple application (e.g., name, address, zip code, phone number, and age).

2FB24EBD24304F6F86A838FC89027D94.description: Begin to use prefixes, suffixes, and root words to determine the meaning of words and extend those meanings in context.

F25F67D2CA2B4F1480919A594FBEBFD7.description: Give word meanings for academic words and words commonly used in print.

47B5AD6AB5FF44AA8D0F97F5D9B4FAF5.description: Begin to use decoding strategies to identify syllables in multi-syllable words.

76E7425C73D94B13B0A91A44D6667627.description: Identify root words, prefixes (e.g., pre-, un-, dis-), and suffixes (e.g., -less, -ly, -ment) and use them to decode multi-syllabic words.

6880139A53CA4DC890D636F02FE8C61B.description: Identify and use contractions and be able to match them to the two words being replaced (e.g., I'm = I am).

E501B10C4BCF4DEC8E59E1DB34EE0346.description: Recognize and spell correctly words with silent consonants (e.g., kn, gh).

37D78441ABA6461C95216BF50EF71264.description: Identify the schwa sound (e.g., about) and use to decode simple words.

CA637539956B43F78BC0B3182C4208A5.description: Identify diphthongs (e.g., away) and use to decode simple words used in stories, texts and theme lessons.

EDFB162C868845DEB6AA020D5474E562.description: Identify long vowel combinations and use them to decode words for word recognition.

4A000EE7DF834DB5B51198E17A12BAC9.description: Identify two and three letter consonant blends (e.g., br-, sp-, cl-, str-, spl-, -sk, -nd). Digraphs (e.g., ch, sh, th, wh) should also be identified in initial, medial, or final word positions and both blends and digraphs should be used to understand word patterns.

4B8B213C3B76422D99AE95C642A96A48.description: Listen and follow along in text as teacher models fluency.

6201F9A76E3F4777955F1493948A37B8.description: Demonstrate self-monitoring strategies (e.g., reread sentences that aren't clear).

2D873C8CD00A4BE58F3C8E3092BF8B9F.description: Read and understand both fiction and nonfiction text that is at the appropriate instructional level.

226E3D9B2CB8474F8571931149EEFED8.description: Locate information from simple charts, graphs, labels, ads and payroll stubs.

D7E1B037EAB5439AB75A29DCD29FA79D.description: Recall facts and details of text.

B4476B7759414B91BE758401918364DB.description: Demonstrate comprehension strategies such as questioning, predicting, clarifying and summarizing.

4810415B0D7845D4B53686C8C147A2EB.description: Locate pertinent information in simple familiar materials (e.g., want ads, job listings, schedules, signs, and food packages).

89042FC072DB433B8DD6DB6C3A9DCE75.description: Through print, apply basic words in context (e.g., by identifying missing words from sentences or cloze exercises).

AC3ADA53E5924EB7A45645D5D090FFA7.description: Through print and oral work, give in-depth meaning of NRS beginning ABE literacy words (e.g., words that are basic and concrete and are used in daily conversation).

D0AD118973EC4A1E95FC05972C01B383.description: Read sight words from an appropriate level word list.

5559E9A904DE4E4BA9775E4E2EB8498D.description: Use syllable patterns to decode single and two-syllable words in appropriately leveled text.

D7466A973D344FC589D586FE19E7E629.description: Use syllable patterns to decode single and two-syllable words.

11EFECEE5D074E87B445F039D87CA327.description: Identify the syllables in a word.

2F146AA5268A4AFCB5DE0288D5005A6A.description: Identify short and long vowels and their sounds.

9ECCEB6DEDCF4B739A6A03F744B3443D.description: Identify single consonants/sounds in initial, medial, and final word positions.

D25D5BCC9F57483DAC8DD244386978AC.description: Manipulate the sounds in a word to assist in recognizing the blending and rhyming of words.

F2BEBC047C6D4D97BCE19436DA9EAC23.description: Identify how many individual sounds there are in a word.

1FA6B83E38134F75B6B3E57BEB3313D1.description: Recognize upper and lower case manuscript letters of the alphabet.

D47F36F8B60F43758680E959A41E4133.description: Recognize the sounds of the letters first and then connect them to print (left to right, top to bottom, front to back, return sweep).
